verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ مُصَدِّقِ بْنِ صَدَقَةَ عَنْ عَمَّارٍ السَّابَاطِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي مُكَاتَبَةٍ بَيْنَ شَرِيكَيْنِ فَيُعْتِقُ أَحَدُهُمَا نَصِيبَهُ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ الْخَادِمُ قَالَ تَخْدُمُ الْبَاقِيَ يَوْماً وَ تَخْدُمُ نَفْسَهَا يَوْماً قُلْتُ فَإِنْ مَاتَتْ وَ تَرَكَتْ مَالًا قَالَ الْمَالُ بَيْنَهُمَا نِصْفَانِ بَيْنَ الَّذِي أَعْتَقَ وَ بَيْنَ الَّذِي أَمْسَكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Ahmad, from Ahmad Bin Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Amro Bin Saeed, from Musaddaf Bin Sadaqa, from Ammar Al Sabaty, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding a contracted slave girl between two partners, so one of them emancipated his share, how should the maid deal with it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘She would serve him for the remainder of the (contracted) days, a day for him (the other partner), and he would serve a day for himself (alternatively)’. I said, ‘So if she were to die and leave wealth?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The wealth is between the two of them, two halves, between the one who emancipated and between the one who did not’.

verses.text:
عَنْهُ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُوسَى الْخَشَّابِ عَنْ غِيَاثِ بْنِ كَلُّوبٍ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ مُكَاتَباً أَتَى أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ إِنَّ سَيِّدِي كَاتَبَنِي وَ شَرَطَ عَلَيَّ نُجُوماً فِي كُلِّ سَنَةٍ فَجِئْتُهُ بِالْمَالِ كُلِّهِ ضَرْبَةً وَاحِدَةً وَ سَأَلْتُهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ كُلَّهُ ضَرْبَةً وَاحِدَةً وَ يُجِيزَ عِتْقِي فَأَبَى عَلَيَّ 
فَدَعَاهُ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ صَدَقَ فَقَالَ لَهُ مَا لَكَ لَا تَأْخُذُ الْمَالَ وَ تُمْضِيَ عِتْقَهُ فَقَالَ مَا آخُذُ إِلَّا النُّجُومَ الَّتِي شَرَطْتُ وَ أَتَعَرَّضُ مِنْ ذَلِكَ لِمِيرَاثِهِ فَقَالَ لَهُ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فَأَنْتَ أَحَقُّ بِشَرْطِكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Al Hassan Bin Musa Al Khashab, from Giyas Bin Kaloub, from Is’haq Bin Ammar, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> (having said) that: ‘A contracted slave came to Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup>, so he said, ‘My master has contracted me and stipulated a condition upon me of installments during every year. So I came with all of the wealth, in one go, and asked him that he should take all of it in one go, and allow me my freedom. But he refused’. 
So Amir Al Momineen<sup>asws</sup> called him over, so he said, ‘He speaks the truth’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to him: ‘So what is the matter with you that you are not taking the wealth and fulfill his emancipation?’ So he said, ‘I will not take except by installments which I had stipulated, and I turn away from the due to his inheritance’. So Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘So you are more rightful of being upon your stipulation’.

verses.text: تَمَّ كِتَابُ الْمَوَارِيثِ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ وَ يَتْلُوهُ كِتَابُ الْحُدُودِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: The Book of the Inheritances is completed, and the Praise is due to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Lord<sup>azwj</sup> of the Worlds, and it is followed by the Book of the Limits.
